definition: to lose money instead of being paid (i.e. sb should pay me, but is actually taking my money)
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to stick/to paste/to post (e.g. on a blog)/to keep close to/to fit snugly/to subsidize/allowance (e.g. money for food or housing)/sticker/classifier for sticking plaster: strip

sentences.english: Monsanto has been paying farmers to use its competitors' herbicides.
sentences.chinese: 孟山都倒貼農民錢去買它的競爭者的除草劑。

sentences.english: This is one man I'd gladly help support by PAYING HIM to stop writing.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個值得你倒貼錢勸他別再瞎寫的作家。

sentences.english: Therefore, putting the "Fu" character up side down is used as a metaphor, showing the arrival of promising spring and auspicious prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 因此，倒貼的“福”字象徵着春天和繁榮昌盛的到來。

sentences.english: People also like to paste the quadrate scrolls upside down, indicating the approach of a new spring and fortune.
sentences.chinese: 人們喜歡把方行聯倒貼，象徵着春天及財富的到來。

sentences.english: You could add a decorative stamp and affix it upside down - a custom that means 'I love you'.
sentences.chinese: 你也可以倒貼張裝飾郵票，這意味着“我愛你”。

definition: unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
brazen
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
to act recklessly/to mess around
hard to say/unpleasant to say/can't be sure
hopelessly muddled/impossible to unravel
dowry
to look for trouble
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
to show respect from a distance (idiom)/to remain at a respectful distance
to both be willing/mutual consent
heterosexuality/heterosexual love
openly and without fear/brazenly
(typically followed by 就[jiu4]) apt to (lose one's temper, catch a cold etc)/at the drop of a hat
